title: Can a creditor garnish my unemployment benefits? These are not tax debts to IRS/FTB but debts for credit cards.
question: I have been paying, but I was laid off and until I obtain employment I can't make the payments.
question_tags: Bankruptcy,Credit,Debt,Wage garnishment,Bankruptcy and debt,Employment,Unemployment compensation,Employee wages and garnishment
answers: Generally speaking, a private creditor cannot garnish your unemployment benefits. However, once the money is in a bank account you need to be careful because a creditor can serve a levy on your bank, which will then freeze the account and give you a little bit of time to demonstrate that the funds are exempt from levy. It would make sense to keep as little money as necessary in your account.
These funds can be taken by levy. Talk to the creditors. Do NOT ignore them.
Public benefits such as unemployment benefits cannot be garnished for credit card debt.
